title: Quiz 3: Transportation (Cardio & Lymph)
description: Assess your knowledge of the Cardiovascular System (Heart, Blood) and Lymphatic System.

questions.question: Which blood component is primarily responsible for transporting oxygen?
questions.explanation: Erythrocytes (Red Blood Cells) contain hemoglobin which binds oxygen. Leukocytes fight infection; Thrombocytes clot blood.

questions.question: Trace the flow of blood through the heart, starting from the body:
questions.explanation: Blood enters Right Atrium -> Right Ventricle -> Lungs -> Left Atrium -> Left Ventricle -> Body.
questions.hint: Right side pumps to lungs, Left side pumps to body.

questions.question: Match the heart valve with its location:

pairs.right: Between Right Atrium and Right Ventricle
Between Left Atrium and Left Ventricle

questions.explanation: Tricuspid is on the right; Mitral is on the left. Semilunar valves (Pulmonic/Aortic) prevent backflow from arteries.
questions.hint: Try to remember 'LAB RAT' (Left Atrium Bicuspid, Right Atrium Tricuspid).

questions.question: Identify the features that distinguish **Arteries** from Veins. (Select all that apply)

options.text: Carry blood away from the heart

questions.explanation: Arteries have thicker walls to withstand high pressure and carry blood AWAY. Veins have valves to prevent backflow.

questions.question: The pacemaker of the heart, which initiates the electrical impulse, is called the ___BLANK___ node.
questions.explanation: The Sinoatrial (SA) node is the natural pacemaker located in the right atrium.
questions.hint: It is abbreviated as SA node.

questions.question: Which large lymphatic vessel drains lymph from the upper right side of the body?
questions.explanation: The Right Lymphatic Duct drains the upper right quadrant. The Thoracic Duct drains the rest of the body.

questions.question: Based on the description below, identify the heart layer.

richContent.content: This is the thickest layer of the heart wall, composed of cardiac muscle tissue responsible for pumping blood.

questions.explanation: Myo- means muscle. Myocardium is the muscular middle layer.

questions.question: The pulmonary artery carries oxygen-rich blood to the body.
questions.explanation: False. The Pulmonary Artery is the only artery carrying deoxygenated blood (to the lungs). The Aorta carries oxygen-rich blood to the body.

questions.question: Which organ of the lymphatic system helps filter blood and destroy old red blood cells?
questions.explanation: The spleen acts as a blood filter and recycles old erythrocytes.
questions.hint: It is located in the upper left abdomen.

questions.question: What is the function of the capillaries?

options.text: Allow exchange of nutrients and gases

questions.explanation: Capillaries have thin walls that allow diffusion of oxygen, nutrients, and waste between blood and tissues.
